prereq.p: Ensure there is sufficient disk space in the place where you intend to dump this data file.
To add a scheduled backup of the entire VNF perform the following steps:

step.cmd: Log in to the CBAM GUI.
Navigate to the CBAM catalogue and select the VNF from the list (the number value under the VNFs label). The VNF-specific window appears.
In the VNF-specific window, click the More button at the end of the line item and select Schedule Backup from the menu.
In the Schedule Backup window, there are two parameters: “schedule_time” and ”schedule_action”.

info.p: For the Schedule_time parameter, the format is the same as the cronjob in Linux, for example: 00 06 * * *
For the Schedule_action parameter, the input can be add or remove; when you add one scheduled backup, set it as "add"

step.cmd: After adding the scheduled backup finishes successfully, log in to the active OAME node and run the "crontab -l" command. The cron jobs for the scheduled backup will appear as follows:

fig.codeblock: */5 * * * * /usr/bin/BR/UpdateCustomerPolicy -m 00 06 * * * echo /usr/bin/BR/BackupVM /etc/BR/policy/vdu-IOHD.group >> /etc/BR/run/BR_SCHEDULE 00 06 * * * echo /usr/bin/BR/BackupVM /etc/BR/policy/vdu-OAME.group >> /etc/BR/run/BR_SCHEDULE 00 06 * * * echo /usr/bin/BR/BackupVM /etc/BR/policy/vdu-DB.group >> /etc/BR/run/BR_SCHEDULE 00 06 * * * echo /usr/bin/BR/BackupVM /etc/BR/policy/vdu-SMApp.group >> /etc/BR/run/BR_SCHEDULE 00 06 * * * echo /usr/bin/BR/BackupVM /etc/BR/policy/vdu-IOHO.group >> /etc/BR/run/BR_SCHEDULE 00 06 * * * echo /usr/bin/BR/BackupVM /etc/BR/policy/vdu-CDR.group >> /etc/BR/run/BR_SCHEDULE 00 06 * * * echo /usr/bin/BR/BackupVM /etc/BR/policy/vdu-COMSVC.group >> /etc/BR/run/BR_SCHEDULE 00 06 * * * echo /usr/bin/BR/BackupVM /etc/BR/policy/vdu-Auxiliary.group >> /etc/BR/run/BR_SCHEDULE 00 06 * * * echo /usr/bin/BR/BackupVM /etc/BR/policy/vdu-DiameterApp.group >> /etc/BR/run/BR_SCHEDULE

info.p: It will take approximately 30 minutes to run a scheduled backup of the VNF.
